subject: Ethics
title: Geneva Conventions Basics
description: A quick, practical guide to Geneva Conventions Basics.

hook.text: After World War II left 70 million dead, nations agreed on rules. Even war needs a rulebook.

buildup.text: The 1949 Geneva Conventions are four treaties signed by every country on Earthâ€”196 nations.

discovery.text: They protect wounded soldiers, prisoners of war, and civilians. Violating them is a war crime.

twist.text: Countries ratified the rules, then broke them repeatedly. The U.S., Russia, and China all have violations.

climax.text: The Conventions work not because they prevent all abuse, but because they create accountability after it.

punchline.text: Every nation signed the rules. Fewer follow them.

quiz.question: How many nations have signed the Geneva Conventions?
options: Only the five permanent UN Security Council members
